item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The painter has the Universe in his mind and hands." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "As you cannot do what you want, Want what you can do" -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Leonardo Da Vinci
item.description: "God sells us all things at the price of labor." -- Leonardo Da Vinci

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "You know what the fellow said – in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias, they had warfare, terror, murder and bloodshed, but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci and the Renaissance. In Switzerland, they had brotherly love, they had five hundred years of democracy and peace – and what did that produce? The cuckoo clock." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?" -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "I do remember, and then when I try to remember, I forget." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "One does not argue about The Wind in the Willows. The young man gives it to the girl with whom he is in love, and, if she does not like it, asks her to return his letters. The older man tries it on his nephew, and alters his will accordingly. The book is a test of character. We can't criticize it, because it is criticizing us. But I must give you one word of warning. When you sit down to it, don't be so ridiculous as to suppose that you are sitting in judgment on my taste, or on the art of Kenneth Grahame. You are merely sitting in judgment on yourself. You may be worthy: I don't know, But it is you who are on trial." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Miline
item.description: "You can't help respecting anybody who can spell TUESDAY, even if he doesn't spell it right; but spelling isn't everything. There are days when spelling Tuesday simply doesn't count." -- A.A. Miline

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Rivers know this there is no hurry. We shall get there some day. " -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Always watch where you are going. Otherwise, you may step on a piece of the Forest that was left out by mistake." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Jef Mallett
item.description: "Writing well means never having to say, "I guess you had to be there." -- Jef Mallett

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "Reader, you must know that an interesting fate (sometimes involving rats, sometimes not) awaits almost everyone, mouse or man, who does not conform." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Rowena add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "Stories are light. Light is precious in a world so dark. Begin at the beginning. Tell Gregory a story. Make some light." -- Kate DiCamillo
